00026 namespace {
00027 
00028 #ifdef HAVE_ICONV
00029 const char * decode_charset_iconv(const char *str) {
00030   const int charset = MeCab::decode_charset(str);
00031   switch (charset) {
00032     case MeCab::UTF8:
00033       return "UTF-8";
00034     case MeCab::EUC_JP:
00035       return "EUC-JP";
00036     case  MeCab::CP932:
00037       return "SHIFT-JIS";
00038     case  MeCab::UTF16:
00039       return "UTF-16";
00040     case  MeCab::UTF16LE:
00041       return "UTF-16LE";
00042     case  MeCab::UTF16BE:
00043       return "UTF-16BE";
00044     default:
00045       std::cerr << "charset " << str
00046                 << " is not defined, use " MECAB_DEFAULT_CHARSET;
00047       return MECAB_DEFAULT_CHARSET;
00048   }
00049   return MECAB_DEFAULT_CHARSET;
00050 }
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00054 DWORD decode_charset_win32(const char *str) {
00055   const int charset = MeCab::decode_charset(str);
00056   switch (charset) {
00057     case MeCab::UTF8:
00058       return CP_UTF8;
00059     case MeCab::UTF16:
00060       return 1200;
00061     case MeCab::UTF16LE:
00062       return 1200;
00063     case MeCab::UTF16BE:
00064       return 1201;
00065     case MeCab::EUC_JP:
00066       //      return 51932;
00067       return 20932;
00068     case MeCab::CP932:
00069       return 932;
00070     default:
00071       std::cerr << "charset " << str
00072                 << " is not defined, use 'CP_THREAD_ACP'";
00073       return CP_THREAD_ACP;
00074   }
00075   return 0;
00076 }
00077 #endif
00078 }  // namespace
00079 
00080 namespace MeCab {
00081 bool Iconv::open(const char* from, const char* to) {
00082   ic_ = 0;
00083 #if defined HAVE_ICONV
00084   const char *from2 = decode_charset_iconv(from);
00085   const char *to2 = decode_charset_iconv(to);
00086   if (std::strcmp(from2, to2) == 0) {
00087     return true;
00088   }
00089   ic_ = 0;
00090   ic_ = iconv_open(to2, from2);
00091   if (ic_ == (iconv_t)(-1)) {
00092     ic_ = 0;
00093     return false;
00094   }
00095 #else
00096 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00097   from_cp_ = decode_charset_win32(from);
00098   to_cp_ = decode_charset_win32(to);
00099   if (from_cp_ == to_cp_) {
00100     return true;
00101   }
00102   ic_ = from_cp_;
00103 #else
00104   std::cerr << "iconv_open is not supported" << std::endl;
00105 #endif
00106 #endif
00107 
00108   return true;
00109 }
00110 
00111 bool Iconv::convert(std::string *str) {
00112   if (str->empty()) {
00113     return true;
00114   }
00115   if (ic_ == 0) {
00116     return true;
00117   }
00118 
00119 #if defined HAVE_ICONV
00120   size_t ilen = 0;
00121   size_t olen = 0;
00122   ilen = str->size();
00123   olen = ilen * 4;
00124   std::string tmp;
00125   tmp.reserve(olen);
00126   char *ibuf = const_cast<char *>(str->data());
00127   char *obuf_org = const_cast<char *>(tmp.data());
00128   char *obuf = obuf_org;
00129   std::fill(obuf, obuf + olen, 0);
00130   size_t olen_org = olen;
00131   iconv(ic_, 0, &ilen, 0, &olen);  // reset iconv state
00132   while (ilen != 0) {
00133     if (iconv(ic_, (ICONV_CONST char **)&ibuf, &ilen, &obuf, &olen)
00134         == (size_t) -1) {
00135       return false;
00136     }
00137   }
00138   str->assign(obuf_org, olen_org - olen);
00139 #else
00140 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
00141   // covert it to wide character first
00142   const size_t wide_len = ::MultiByteToWideChar(from_cp_, 0,
00143                                                 str->c_str(),
00144                                                 -1, NULL, 0);
00145   if (wide_len == 0) {
00146     return false;
00147   }
00148 
00149   scoped_array<wchar_t> wide_str(new wchar_t[wide_len + 1]);
00150 
00151   if (!wide_str.get()) {
00152     return false;
00153   };
00154 
00155   if (::MultiByteToWideChar(from_cp_, 0, str->c_str(), -1,
00156                             wide_str.get(), wide_len + 1) == 0) {
00157     return false;
00158   }
00159 
00160   if (to_cp_ == 1200 || to_cp_ == 1201) {
00161     str->resize(2 * wide_len);
00162     memcpy(const_cast<char *>(str->data()),
00163            reinterpret_cast<char *>(wide_str.get()), wide_len * 2);
00164     if (to_cp_ == 1201) {
00165       char *buf = const_cast<char *>(str->data());
00166       for (size_t i = 0; i < 2 * wide_len; i += 2) {
00167         std::swap(buf[i], buf[i+1]);
00168       }
00169     }
00170     return true;
00171   }
00172 
00173   const size_t output_len = ::WideCharToMultiByte(to_cp_, 0,
00174                                                   wide_str.get(),
00175                                                   -1,
00176                                                   NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
00177 
00178   if (output_len == 0) {
00179     return false;
00180   }
00181 
00182   scoped_array<char> encoded(new char[output_len + 1]);
00183   if (::WideCharToMultiByte(to_cp_, 0, wide_str.get(), wide_len,
00184                             encoded.get(), output_len + 1,
00185                             NULL, NULL) == 0) {
00186     return false;
00187   }
00188 
00189   str->assign(encoded.get());
00190 
00191 #endif
00192 #endif
00193 
00194   return true;
00195 }

00197 Iconv::Iconv() : ic_(0)  {}
00198 
00199 Iconv::~Iconv() {
00200 #if defined HAVE_ICONV
00201   if (ic_ != 0) iconv_close(ic_);
00202 #endif
00203 }
00204 }
